definition: Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: Hu Shi's value system of scientific education was characterized by pure science.
sentences.chinese: 胡適的科學教育價值觀是以惟科學主義爲特徵的。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅與胡適是新文學的開創者與奠基人。

sentences.english: Hu Shi's methodology of history implied two aspects: technical and spiritual.
sentences.chinese: 胡適的歷史方法內涵展現在技術和精神兩個層面上。

sentences.english: Hushi's translation ideas rise in his literary proposition .
sentences.chinese: 胡適之譯學理念發軔於其文學主張。

sentences.english: This paper attempts to analyse the split reason from the position of Hushi for New Culture Movement.
sentences.chinese: 本文從胡適對新文化運動的主張試分析其分裂的原因。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese poem, Hu Shi's A Collection of Attempting Modern Langnage Poem is a sign of new era.
sentences.chinese: 在我國詩歌史上，胡適《嘗試集》是劃時代的標誌。

sentences.english: Hu Shi's Experiment has epitomized these tendencies.
sentences.chinese: 胡適的《嘗試集》就縮影着這種發展趨勢。

sentences.english: The Chinese literature conception of Hushi was shaped in that term.
sentences.chinese: 胡適的中國文學觀主要就是在這一時期形成的。

sentences.english: As a thinker, Hu Shi's thought of law is very abundant.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個思想家，胡適的法律思想非常豐富。

sentences.english: Hu Shih s thought of multiparty politics came into being during his study in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國留學期間，胡適形成了“多黨政治”的思想。

sentences.english: Hu Shis viewpoints have some positive significance.
sentences.chinese: 胡適的觀點有一定的積極意義。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modern literature.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅與胡適是新文學的開創者與奠基人。

sentences.english: The second chapter is on the criticism against Hushi.
sentences.chinese: 第二章寫史學領域的胡適批判。

definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
"Redology", academic field devoted to the study of A Dream of Red Mansions
